answers.answer: you can eat the stuff it all depends on the portion size.  I have gestational diabetes right now and I am watching what i eat and check my sugar level 4-5 times a day.  15grams of carbs is 1 carb choice.  If somethings have fiber in it and the labels says more then 5g then you can subtract the grams of fiber from the total carbs which will reduce the amount.  I was told that i could eat up to 17 CHOICES a day, but that is based on where i am at in my pregnacy (31w3d) and my weight.  I don't come anywhere near that amount a day and have been doing really well keeping it under control.  You basically have to spread the number out throughout the day.  Also you have to eat breakfast, morning snack, lunch, afternoon snack, dinner, and then a snack before bed, they say to do this to keep you numbers in control b/c if you don't eat your liver automatically will push out sugar into your blood thinking that your not getting enough, and that will cause your numbers to skyrocket.  If you want to know more then feel free to ask.PS> don't forget to watch the serving sizes on the label b/c thats what the carbs is based off!
What do you like to eat?? and what do you snack on?? Example of what you ate yesterday for example maybe??

Breakfast- bowl of cereal (usually rice krispies)snack-  apple, if i'm really hungry i'll have a few crackers tooLunch-  smartones tv dinnersnack-  smartfood popcorn (less carbs then chips and better for you so you can have alittle more then you would be able to if it was chips and fill up a little)Dinner- chicken breast, pasta or potatoe, and a veggi.....some veggies are free and don't count against you but some do...so be careful) saladsnack-  usually fruit or smartfood popcorn

I failed both the 1hour and the 3 hour horribly.  I was very sick in the begining and lost 10lbs, so far at 31w3d i only weigh 6lbs over my normal weight.  I am a very picky eater and found that the hardest part for me was remembering to eat every few hours and to look at the carbs in the food, i was orignally writing down everything i eat and keeping track of the choices, but now i just do it mentally and have been doing really well. Also pricking your fingers all the time sucks but i am happy that i don't need insulin or anything like that.  My sugar levels are staying relatively normal and i haven't been having many side affects at all.  The baby is measuring right on track and NOT bigger, which is something that can happen when you have this.
